p: The soil plant-available phosphorus (P 2O 5) in experimental fields varied from 112.70 (C) to 689.55 mg kg âˆ’1 (A). Thus, the phosphorus content in the soils was sufficient [ 28]. Phosphorus is an essential component in many vital plant processes. In the case of insufficient phosphorus in the soil, plants develop and grow poorly, and their leaves curl [ 31].
